> 
> Not really.  NEAT builds fixed-weight topologies.  A fixed-weight
> topology CAN'T learn.  We learn.  Thus, inherently, NEAT and true
> intelligence don't go together very well...
> 

I guess it all comes down to this and I disagree.  I imagine that when you
learn, it is not a topological innovation.  I think that would make for an
extremely complex brain and might even call phrenology back into vouge
depending on how radical the topoligical changes were :)

- jeff
